description: '''''Sangeet Natak''''' ([[Marathi language|Marathi]] for 'musical drama') is a form of [[drama]] which combines [[prose]] and [[poetry]] in the form of [[songs]] to convey the [[Narrative|story]], similar to [[Musical theatre|musicals]]. They have played a vital role in the development of Marathi theater and [[Marathi cinema|cinema]], as well as the [[Indian film industry]]. ''Sangeet Nataks'' start with the praise of [[Natraj|Lord Natraja]], which is called ''Naandi'', ''Mangalaacharan'' or ''Suchakpad'' â€“ usually the famous "Panchatunda Nararundamaldhar" from ''Sangeet Shakuntal''. They are popular for the use of [[Indian classical music]]. The "Dramatic Music" is called ''Natya Sangeet'', one of the two popular forms of vocal arts in [[Maharashtra]] and surrounding states. The other is ''[[Bhavageet]]''.
